intro: Galium × ochroleucum subsp. latifolium, commonly known as broadleaf wood-sorrel, is a hybrid plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and opposite, ovate to elliptic leaves that are typically broader than those of its parent species. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are often borne on short pedicels. It is native to Europe and is commonly found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
